pros: The senior leadership truly cares about the success and well-being of employees. The agency strives to provide support and resources to people with developmental disabilities, and does a really great job of it. I believe this is the only developmental disabilities service provider in the province that has a social committee to encourage strong, friendly relationships. We have great employee recognition programs, a thorough training program, opportunities for advancement, a commitment to diversity in hiring, a safe environment, and an agency history to be proud of. The vision of the DDRC is "everyone belongs," and it lives by this vision.
cons: We're funded by the government, so you never really know if there are going to be funding cuts or changes to what is funded in the future.
